AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: ATLAS provided generic troubleshooting and a keyboard-shortcut workaround that the customer immediately reported did not work, indicating the AI guidance was at least partially misleading. ATLAS also appears to reiterate content already being handled by human agents (duplicate-style summaries/recommendations), which can add noise rather than move the investigation forward.

This is direct evidence that context already provided in the ticket was not fully incorporated into the next troubleshooting step.

Given recall-first instructions, the CSV timings alone are sufficient to flag response delay risk.

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: The customer reports active production impact (agents unable to send replies without refresh; “chat service not functioning as expected” and “degraded level of service”), which may warrant higher-severity handling. The support motion shown is largely routine troubleshooting and debate over customer network/proxy, with no visible urgent escalation path captured in the provided excerpts—so this is flagged as potential sev mishandling (some uncertainty because severity/SLAs are not explicitly stated).
